result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Melchor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.
  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Ct.2 but CONSECUTIVE to 09CF406.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Ct.1 but CONSECUTIVE to 09CF406.

for Sentence Modification (dated 9/22/17) re DNA surcharge filed by DE pro se.

Pro se request to vacate the DNA surcharge filed by def.
Request denied by the Court on 8/19/15, as the law requires assessment of DNA fee on each felony conviction.
Cts.3,4, and 5 -Dismissed & read in  kmk
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court re-takes plea on this date to correct the record.  On State's motion, cts 3, 4 & 5 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  Court imposes a total sentence of 10 years WSP, concurrent on cts 1 & 2 and consecutive to 09CF406; 5 years initial confinement; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $500 DNA surcharge.
5/4/15 - Plea Hearing

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 3, 4 & 5 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 6/15/15 at 2pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody by phone w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz states he just received a response from the State today on his counter offer; would like to discuss it w/deft.  STC continued to 5/4/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Jenny/Fox Lake Correctional Institution a phone appearance is set for the deft for the STC on 3/24/15 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody by phone w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett. With Jenny/Fox Lake Correctional Institution a phone appearance is set for the deft for the STC on 3/4/15 at 8:45am.

With Atty Marry the FPT of 10/28/14 at 8:45am is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 12/12/14 at 8:45am.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 10/28/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
